episodeTitle: Luffy Falls! God's Judgment and Nami's Wish!!
episodeTitleJapanese: ルフィ落下！神の裁きとナミの望み！！
episodeTitleRomanized: Rufi Rakka! Kami no Sabaki to Nami no Nozomi!!
description: Enel traps Luffy's hand in a molten gold ball, causing him to fall from the Ark Maxim. Nami confronts Enel alone, expressing her desire to sail with her crew once more. Sanji and Usopp launch a daring rescue mission to save Nami from the flying ark.

events.title: Luffy's Gomu Gomu no Rifle Lands on Enel
events.description: Luffy successfully executes his Gomu Gomu no Rifle attack, punching Enel into one of the golden walls of the Ark Maxim. The impact causes significant damage to the ark's structure and demonstrates Luffy's ability to harm the self-proclaimed god.
events.significance: This attack shows that despite Enel's invincibility against most opponents, Luffy's rubber body makes him a legitimate threat. The damage to the ark also reveals the vessel's vulnerability.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's attack on Enel that sends him into the golden wall

events.title: Enel Creates Golden Ball Trap
events.description: Enel demonstrates an advanced application of his Goro Goro no Mi powers by using his electricity to melt the golden wall and mold it into a massive sphere. He traps Luffy's hand inside the extremely hot molten gold, creating a heavy ball that acts as an anchor.
events.significance: This reveals Enel's ability to manipulate materials through his electrical powers, showing his combat creativity and tactical thinking. The gold ball becomes a critical plot device that affects the battle's progression.

quotes.text: Let me give you a parting gift before you fall.
quotes.speaker: Enel
quotes.context: Enel creates the gold ball around Luffy's hand

events.title: Luffy Falls from Ark Maxim
events.description: After being trapped in the golden ball, Luffy loses his grip on the ark and falls from the flying ship. The massive weight of the gold pulls him downward through the clouds, seemingly removing him from the battle. Enel uses his spear to destroy the ship wall Luffy was using to hold on.
events.significance: This appears to be Luffy's defeat and removal from the climactic battle. It forces the other crew members to step up and creates a desperate situation where Nami must face Enel alone. This moment sets up Luffy's dramatic return later in the arc.

quotes.speaker: Enel
quotes.context: Enel destroys Luffy's handhold, causing him to fall

events.title: Nami's Declaration of Her Dream
events.description: Alone on the ark with Enel, Nami expresses her deepest desires. She tells Enel about her wish to continue sailing with her crew and experience the world together. She declares that without her friends, there is nothing she truly wants, even if it means material wealth or safety.
events.significance: This is a powerful character moment for Nami that showcases her growth from a materialistic thief to someone who values her nakama above all else. It demonstrates the core theme of One Piece about the importance of bonds and dreams shared with friends.

quotes.text: There's plenty that I want to have and want to do. But if I follow you, I'll be alone. Without my friends, there is nothing that I actually want.
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami's response to Enel asking about her desires

quotes.text: I want to be able to sail the sea with them one more time.
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami thinking about her crew while facing Enel

events.title: Sanji and Usopp Notice Missing Nami
events.description: Down on the ground, Conis and the others notice that Sanji and Usopp have disappeared from the Going Merry. The two injured Straw Hats have departed on a rescue mission after realizing Nami is in danger aboard the flying ark.
events.significance: This sets up the rescue subplot and shows the crew's dedication to each other despite their injuries and the seemingly impossible task of reaching a flying ship.

events.title: Usopp AAaaaAAAaaaAA Rescue Device
events.description: Usopp deploys his specially designed grappling device called 'Usopp AAaaaAAAaaaAA' to reach the Ark Maxim. Despite Usopp's severe acrophobia and screaming, Sanji kicks the device toward the flying ark, hooking onto its lower deck.
events.significance: This demonstrates Usopp's inventiveness and preparation, as well as his willingness to overcome his fears for his nakama. The comedic name reflects Usopp's panic during high-altitude operations.

quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Usopp screaming as he deploys his grappling device

events.title: Sanji Climbs to Save Nami
events.description: Despite his severe injuries from previous battles, Sanji climbs the rope attached to the Ark Maxim while Usopp dangles below, screaming in terror. Sanji's determination to save Nami drives him forward despite the dangerous height and his physical condition.
events.significance: This exemplifies Sanji's character trait of prioritizing women's safety above his own well-being, and shows the lengths the Straw Hats will go to save their nakama. It sets up the rescue attempt that will unfold in subsequent episodes.

events.title: Nami Prepares to Fight Enel
events.description: With Luffy fallen and no rescue in sight, Nami readies her Clima-Tact to face Enel directly. She steels herself for battle, knowing she must survive until help arrives. Enel stands before her, amused by her determination.
events.significance: This sets up the David vs. Goliath battle between Nami and one of the arc's most powerful antagonists. It shows Nami's courage and growth as a fighter, willing to face an opponent far beyond her level to protect her dreams.

quotes.text: I will put everything I have to survive this.
quotes.speaker: Nami

events.title: Enel Reveals Ark Maxim's Purpose
events.description: Enel retells his plans to destroy Skypiea using the Ark Maxim and ascend to Fairy Vearth (the Moon). He explains that the ark is designed to carry him to his promised land where he believes he truly belongs as a god.
events.significance: This reveals important information about Enel's motivations and the technological capabilities of the ancient sky people. It also foreshadows Enel's eventual journey to the moon in the cover stories.

events.title: Aisa Witnesses Luffy's Fall
events.description: Young Aisa, with her Mantra abilities, senses and witnesses Luffy falling from the ark. She and others on the ground watch in horror as Luffy plummets through the clouds with the massive gold ball attached to his arm.
events.significance: This provides perspective from the ground level and shows the impact of the aerial battle on those below. Aisa's Mantra confirms what happened to Luffy.

quotes.text: There's plenty that I want to have and want to do. But if I follow you, I'll be alone. Without my friends, there is nothing that I actually want.
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami's declaration to Enel about her true desires

quotes.text: I want to be able to sail the sea with them one more time.
quotes.speaker: Nami
Enel
quotes.context: Enel destroying Luffy's hold on the ark

themes.description: The episode strongly emphasizes the bonds between the Straw Hat crew. Nami's declaration that without her friends there is nothing she wants demonstrates the series' core value of friendship over material gain.
themes.symbolism: The gold ball represents material wealth and power trying to drag Luffy down, while his crew's determination to rescue each other represents the strength of their bonds.

themes.description: Despite severe injuries, Sanji and Usopp risk their lives to save Nami. Nami faces an overwhelming opponent to survive and reunite with her crew. These acts of courage show the crew's willingness to sacrifice for each other.
themes.symbolism: Sanji climbing the rope to reach the ark symbolizes the difficult path one must take to protect those they care about.

themes.description: The episode contrasts Enel's dream of ruling alone on the moon with Nami's dream of sailing with her friends. It questions what true happiness and fulfillment mean.
themes.symbolism: Enel offers Nami material wealth and power, but she chooses her friends instead, showing that shared dreams are more valuable than solitary glory.

characterSpotlights.development: Nami demonstrates significant character growth by choosing her crew over safety and material gain. Her willingness to fight Enel despite knowing she's outmatched shows how far she's come from her Arlong Park days.
keyActions: Confronts Enel alone after Luffy falls
Declares her desire to sail with her crew over everything else
Prepares to fight Enel with her Clima-Tact
quotes: There's plenty that I want to have and want to do. But if I follow you, I'll be alone. Without my friends, there is nothing that I actually want.
I want to be able to sail the sea with them one more time.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy's fall represents a turning point in the battle, forcing his crew to step up. The gold ball that defeats him will later become instrumental in his victory.
keyActions: Lands Gomu Gomu no Rifle on Enel
Gets trapped in the golden ball

characterSpotlights.development: Sanji's willingness to climb to the flying ark despite his injuries showcases his dedication to protecting the crew's women and his nakama in general.
keyActions: Wakes Usopp for the rescue mission
Kicks Usopp's grappling device toward the ark
Climbs the rope to reach the Ark Maxim

characterSpotlights.development: Enel demonstrates his tactical intelligence and cruelty by creating the golden ball trap. His conversation with Nami reveals his lonely vision of godhood.
keyActions: Creates the golden ball to trap Luffy
Causes Luffy to fall from the ark
Explains his plan to destroy Skypiea and reach Fairy Vearth

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended the scene of Sanji and Usopp's rescue attempt with additional comedic moments of Usopp's acrophobia.
Additional reaction shots from characters on the ground watching Luffy fall were added for dramatic effect.

trivia.fact: This episode adapts portions of two manga chapters: Chapter 282 'Desire' and Chapter 283 'On the Front Line of Rescuing Love'.
The episode's title in Japanese uses the character '望み' (nozomi) for 'wish/desire', which is also the title of Chapter 282 that this episode adapts.

Nami's declaration about choosing her friends over material wealth is one of the most significant character moments in the Skypiea arc, showing her complete transformation from her Arlong Park characterization.
The golden ball that Enel creates to defeat Luffy will later become instrumental in Luffy's victory, showcasing Oda's foreshadowing and setup-payoff structure.
The ending theme 'Tsuki to Taiyo' (Moon and Sun) by Shela is thematically appropriate for this arc, as Enel's goal is to reach the moon.

sources.title: Tsuki to Taiyo - One Piece Wiki
